title: Xi’an City provides anti-epidemic materials to Azerbaijan in May 2020
description: On May 5, 2020, Xi’an City, a municipality of the Shaanxi Province in China, provided anti-epidemic supplies to Sumgait City in Azerbaijan. The supplies included 100,000 disposable medical surgical masks, 2,000 sets of medical protective clothing, 1,000 pairs of goggles, 100 forehead temperature guns, 1 ventilator, 1 real-time fluorescent quantitative PCR instrument, 1 nucleic acid extraction instrument, 1,000 packages of cell preservation solution and 157 boxes of virus DNA/RNA extraction kits. The total estimated value of this donation is 1.645 million yuan.  A handover ceremony was held for this donation. The ceremony was attended by heads of relevant government departments and medical staff representatives. Specifics on who was in attendance are unavailable.
combined_text:
# Sector
HEALTH

# Title
Xi’an City provides anti-epidemic materials to Azerbaijan in May 2020

# Description
On May 5, 2020, Xi’an City, a municipality of the Shaanxi Province in China, provided anti-epidemic supplies to Sumgait City in Azerbaijan. The supplies included 100,000 disposable medical surgical masks, 2,000 sets of medical protective clothing, 1,000 pairs of goggles, 100 forehead temperature guns, 1 ventilator, 1 real-time fluorescent quantitative PCR instrument, 1 nucleic acid extraction instrument, 1,000 packages of cell preservation solution and 157 boxes of virus DNA/RNA extraction kits. The total estimated value of this donation is 1.645 million yuan.  A handover ceremony was held for this donation. The ceremony was attended by heads of relevant government departments and medical staff representatives. Specifics on who was in attendance are unavailable.
justification: Project involves donation of medical supplies for epidemic prevention, with no direct environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: Anti-epidemic supplies including masks, protective clothing, medical equipment, and testing kits

title: Mianyang City government provides anti-epidemic supplies to Azerbaijan in April 2020
description: On April 12, 2020, Mianyang City, a municipality of the Sichuan Province in China, provided anti-epidemic supplies to Sumgait, a city in Azerbaijan. The supplies included 50,000 medical protective masks, 2,000 protective masks, 2,000 goggles, 1,000 sets of protective clothing, 120,000 shoe covers, and 300 infrared thermometers. These supplies will be used to support COVID-19 prevention and response efforts in Azerbaijan. The total estimated value of this donation is 600,000 yuan.  A handover ceremony was held for this donation. Various heads of government departments and medical staff representatives attended the ceremony. Specifics on attendees of the ceremony are unknown.

title: Chinese government provides second and third batch of anti-epidemic supplies to Azerbaijan in May 2020 (linked to Project ID#93960)
description: On May 21, 2020, the Chinese government provided anti-epidemic supplies to Azerbaijan. The donated supplies included 5,000 nucleic acid testing reagents, 10 non-invasive ventilators, 3,500 sets of medical protective clothing, 600,000 medical masks, and 50,000 KN95 masks. The monetary value of this donation is unknown.  A handover ceremony was held for this donation at the Ministry of Foreign Affairs in Azerbaijan. China’s Ambassador to Azerbaijan, Guo Min, Deputy Foreign Minister Hasanov, Deputy Health Minister Gasimov, Foreign Ministry Spokesperson Abdullayeva, and representatives of local mainstream media attended the ceremony. Ambassador Guo Min and Deputy Health Minister Gasimov jointly signed the handover certificate for this donation.  The first batch of anti-epidemic supplies is covered in Project ID#93960.
staff_comments: AidData has estimated the transaction amount for this donation based on price catalogues from the World Health Organization (WHO). Please see the TUFF Methodology for additional details.

title: Sichuan Provincial Government provides anti-epidemic supplies to Azerbaijan in May 2020
description: On May 11, 2020, the Sichuan Provincial Government of China provided anti-epidemic supplies to Baku, the capital city of Azerbaijan. The donated supplies will be used to improve COVID-19 prevention and response efforts in Azerbaijan.   The specific type, amount and monetary value of this donation are unknown, but at least some or most of the supplies are from Chengdu Xinjin Shifeng Medical Apparatus & Instrument Co. Ltd., a Chinese medical instrument manufacturer.

title: Quzhou City provides anti-epidemic supplies to Sumgait City, Azerbaijan in April 2020

title: Bank of China contributes  to $210 million syndicated loan to help Azerbaijan’s state-owned oil company (SOCAR)
description: In August 2020, SOCAR Trading S.A. — the international marketing and development arm of the State Oil Company of Azerbaijan Republic (SOCAR) — secured a $210 million syndicated loan with 10 banks. Bank of China reportedly contributed $21 million. The proceeds of the loan were to be used by the borrower to amend, extend and increase an existing syndicated credit facility.
combined_text:
# Sector
BUSINESS AND OTHER SERVICES

# Title
Bank of China contributes  to $210 million syndicated loan to help Azerbaijan’s state-owned oil company (SOCAR)

# Description
In August 2020, SOCAR Trading S.A. — the international marketing and development arm of the State Oil Company of Azerbaijan Republic (SOCAR) — secured a $210 million syndicated loan with 10 banks. Bank of China reportedly contributed $21 million. The proceeds of the loan were to be used by the borrower to amend, extend and increase an existing syndicated credit facility.
justification: Loan supports Azerbaijan's state-owned oil company, directly enabling fossil fuel operations
evidence: Funding provided to SOCAR Trading S.A., the international marketing arm of Azerbaijan's state oil company

title: Chinese Embassy donates anti-epidemic supplies to Bahamas Ministry of Health in April 2020
description: On April 4, 2020, the Chinese Embassy in the Commonwealth of the Bahamas donated 1,000 Coronavirus testing kits, KN-95 masks, gloves, and other supplies to the Bahamas Ministry of Health in order to combat the Coronavirus. The Chinese Embassy in the Commonwealth of the Bahamas handed over the supplies.
staff_comments: The Commonwealth of the Bahamas was not ODA-Eligible in 2020.AidData has estimated the transaction amount for this donation based on price catalogues from the World Health Organization (WHO). Please see the TUFF Methodology for additional details.
